description: The Department of Government Efficiency started as an inside joke. It’s since enabled the world’s richest man to become the most powerful person in the country, after President Donald Trump. And yet the department-that’s-not-a-department remains something of an enigma.
title: How Elon Musk’s DOGE Is Reshaping the US Government

description: Armed men affiliated with Syria’s toppled regime carried out surprise attacks on the port city of Latakia and other Mediterranean areas, killing more than a dozen security people in some of the fiercest confrontations since the ouster of President Bashar al-Assad in December.
title: Assad Loyalists Carry Out Deadly Raids, Shaking War-Weary Syria

description: Samuel Bankman-Fried appeared on former Fox News host Tucker Carlson’s podcast, bashing former President Joe Biden and Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler as his parents seek a pardon from Donald Trump.
title: Sam Bankman-Fried Bashes Biden, Gensler on Tucker Carlson’s Podcast

description: British Columbia will introduce legislation letting it charge tolls on commercial vehicles heading to Alaska in retaliation against President Donald Trump’s tariffs.
title: Trump Tariffs on Canada Mean New Fees for Alaska-Bound Trucks

description: The Trump administration’s ongoing review of offshore wind projects will feature different treatment for existing ventures versus those that are still merely in the proposed stage, Interior Secretary Doug Burgum said Thursday.
title: US Offshore Wind Review to Account for Farm Status, Burgum Says

description: Sunny Hu was about to go to bed when her phone lit up bearing bad news for her outdoor furniture business: More US tariffs just dropped.
title: Spooked China Exporters Say US Consumers Will Share Tariff Pain

description: Claudia Sheinbaum’s dispassionate style on the campaign trail was once seen as such a political weakness that her opponent in last year’s Mexican presidential election branded her “The Ice Queen.”
title: ‘Ice Queen’ No More: Sheinbaum Charms Trump on Tariffs

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economy reporter Jarrell Dillard looks at the impact that federal job cuts are having. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: DOGE Cuts, Spending Freezes Starting to Ripple Through Job Market

description: An Egyptian proposal for the reconstruction of Gaza, which was backed by leaders of Arab countries, doesn’t meet the Trump administration’s expectations for how the Palestinian enclave should be rebuilt, according to the State Department.
title: US Says Egypt’s Plan to Rebuild Gaza Fails to Meet Requirements

description: President Donald Trump said that the Treasury Department or other agencies could potentially take over administering student loans if his administration were to abolish the Education Department, which currently oversees the issue.
title: Trump Floats Handing Off Student Loan Management to Treasury

description: President Donald Trump said he would “probably” extend the deadline for the sale for social video app TikTok if a deal is not reached by April 5.
title: Trump Open to Again Extending TikTok Deadline If Necessary

description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said Ukraine should be granted the security of NATO without the actual membership in the military alliance.
title: Meloni Backs Giving Ukraine NATO Security Without Membership

description: President Donald Trump said shipping giant CMA CGM SA would invest $20 billion into the United States to build out shipping logistics, infrastructure and terminals.
title: Trump Says Shipping Giant CMA CGM to Invest $20 Billion in US

description: Twenty-six European Union leaders ignored Hungary to back a declaration of support for Ukraine at an emergency meeting, underscoring the difficult road ahead as the bloc tries to adopt ambitious reforms to mobilize new support for Kyiv.
title: EU Leaves Hungary Behind as It Pledges to Boost Ukraine Aid

description: President Donald Trump said he directed cabinet secretaries to use a “scalpel” rather than a “hatchet” to make personnel cuts, a directive aiming to quell blowback after waves of job cuts have roiled the federal workforce.
title: Trump Orders Cabinet Chiefs, Not Musk’s DOGE, to Cut Workforce

description: The European Union agreed to begin discussions on a long-term reform of its fiscal rules to allow member states to spend more on defense, following a push from Germany.
title: EU Backs German Push to Look at Easing Fiscal Rules for Defense

description: California Governor Gavin Newsom, a longtime advocate for LGBTQ rights, expressed concern about transgender athletes competing in women’s sports, taking a more conservative stance on an issue that has become politically divisive for Democrats.
title: Gavin Newsom Calls Trans Athletes in Women’s Sports ‘Deeply Unfair’

description: If attacked, Europe’s ammunition stockpiles could run low within days and rearming will take years.
title: Europe’s Defenses Risk Faltering Within Weeks Without US Support

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent rejected the idea that President Donald Trump’s tariff hikes will ignite a new wave of inflation, and suggested that the Federal Reserve ought to view them as having a one-time impact.
title: Bessent Highlights Trump’s Fed Silence, Rejects Inflation Worry

description: The Republican-led House Judiciary Committee subpoenaed Alphabet Inc. and its CEO Sundar Pichai as part of its ongoing investigation into the biggest tech companies’ relationships with the Biden administration.
title: Alphabet Gets House GOP Subpoena on Alleged Speech Censorship

description: President Donald Trump’s administration is moving to reclassify top federal agency human resource jobs as political roles, reversing a longstanding policy for personnel chiefs to be career government officials.
title: Trump Tightens Control Over Federal HR Chiefs, Politicizing Roles

description: The US will not hesitate to go “all in” on sanctions on Russian energy if it helps lead to a ceasefire in the Ukraine war, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Thursday.
title: US Won’t Hesitate on Russia and Iran Sanctions, Bessent Says

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Russia should pledge to halt airstrikes and naval military operations as the first step toward showing that it’s serious about ending the three-year war.
title: Zelenskiy Seeks Russia Pledge to Halt Air and Navy Strikes

description: European officials have been told that President Donald Trump wants to link the proposed US-Ukraine minerals deal to demands for Kyiv to commit to a quick ceasefire with Russia, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Presses Ukraine for Quick Ceasefire to Go With Minerals Deal

description: Mariano “Tute” Di Tella, fan del presidente argentino, fabrica motosierras personalizadas en Buenos Aires. La masacre de Texas fue su inspiración de la infancia
title: El hombre detrás de las motosierras de Milei y Musk ahora fabrica una para Trump

description: The head of an independent whistleblower agency is ending his legal fight over President Donald Trump’s decision to fire him after a federal appeals court allowed the removal to go forward during his lawsuit.
title: Whistleblower Chief Fired by Trump Drops Fight After Court Loss

description: Canada is expanding its military presence in the Arctic region as it tries to appease the Trump administration’s calls for higher defense spending and deter Chinese and Russian influence in the remote region.
title: Canada Eyes Arctic Military Expansion in Response to Trump’s Demands

description: The world needs to prepare to fight global warming without the help of the US as the Trump administration pulls billions of dollars pledged to initiatives funding the green transition, the UK’s climate envoy said.
title: World Must Prepare to Fight Climate Change Without US, UK Says

description: Germany’s borrowings may balloon by as much as 13% of gross domestic product within the next half decade to fund its planned spending on defense and infrastructure, according to Scope Ratings.
title: German Debt May Swell by €625 Billion in Five Years, Scope Says

description: The IMF warned Canada and Mexico are vulnerable to “significant adverse economic impact” if President Donald Trump sustains tariffs on those countries given their exposure to US markets.
title: IMF Says US Tariffs Risk ‘Significant’ Hit to Canada, Mexico

description: The UK removed the Syrian central bank and 23 other entities from a list of sanctioned institutions, a recognition of the country’s new administration following the overthrow of former President Bashar Al-Assad.
title: UK Lifts Sanctions From Syria Entities in Boost to New Leaders

description: President Donald Trump is likely to defer his 25% tariffs on Canada and Mexico for all goods and services covered by the North American trade agreement known as USMCA, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said, a potentially major reprieve for the US’s two largest trading partners.
title: Trump Likely to Defer Tariffs on USMCA Goods, Lutnick Says

description: The White House is giving potential job candidates litmus tests in interviews to make sure they are sufficiently loyal to President Donald Trump and his second-term agenda, according to people familiar with the process.
title: Trump Team Tests Job Candidates by Asking Who Won the 2020 Election

description: Ukraine’s former top military commander warned that the US is “destroying” the world’s established order, delivering a sharp critique of Donald Trump’s approach to Russia that risks hampering President Volodymyr Zelenskiy attempt to repair ties.
title: Ukraine’s Zaluzhnyi Says US Is ‘Destroying’ the World Order

description: A federal judge issued a long-term order blocking President Donald Trump’s controversial attempt to freeze billions of dollars in Congress-approved loans, grants and other payments to recipients across the US.
title: Trump Spending Freeze on Grants, Loans Blocked by Another Judge

description: Mariano ‘Tute’ Di Tella, a fan of the Argentine president, crafts custom power saws in Buenos Aires. The Texas Chain Saw Massacre was his childhood inspiration.
title: Musk and Milei’s Chainsaw Maker Is Crafting Another for Trump

description: The US trade deficit widened to a record in January as companies scrambled to secure goods from overseas before President Donald Trump imposed tariffs on America’s largest trading partners.
title: US Trade Deficit Surged to a Record Ahead of Trump Tariffs

description: The European Union is moving toward easing its fiscal rules to allow for more defense spending after a U-turn from Germany won support from some traditional opponents of increasing borrowing.
title: Germany’s Push to Loosen EU Fiscal Rules Is Gathering Momentum

description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s business ally, whose company is seeking to partner with Elon Musk’s SpaceX, was named Hungary’s special envoy for international investments.
title: Orban Ally Seeking SpaceX Deal Named Special Envoy in Hungary

description: European Union leaders arriving in Brussels Thursday urged a revolutionary change to rebuild military infrastructure after decades of neglect and create a brand new security architecture in order to counter Russia.
title: Europe Confronts Defense Gaps as Trump Backs Away From Ukraine

description: US President Donald Trump has long said he would negotiate a quick end to Russia’s war in Ukraine. In pursuit of a deal, the US has engaged with the Kremlin while pressuring Kyiv to support the peace initiative.
title: What Trump’s Pause on Military Aid Means for Ukraine

description: The ability of German conservative leader Friedrich Merz to form a government will be tested Thursday as negotiations with the Social Democrats turn to migration, an issue that laid bare sharp divisions before last month’s election.
title: German Coalition Talks Take a Rough Turn on Migration Dispute

description: China’s top trade official said he’s been trying to establish a communication channel with the US to start talks on resolving bilateral trade disputes.
title: China’s Commerce Chief Wrote to US Seeking Dialogue Last Month

description: Loyal Source Government Services remains the chief healthcare provider for migrants in border custody almost two years after a child died.
title: Federal Medical Contractor Is Cashing In Despite Troubled Record

description: China is planning to increase support for its technology companies as the sector makes rapid advances in artificial intelligence.
title: China Steps Up Support for Tech Sector as AI Enthusiasm Soars

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: All (Belt and) Roads Now Lead to Trump’s Washington

description: Russia “categorically” opposes any deal that allows European troops to act as peacekeepers in Ukraine, Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said.
title: Russia’s Lavrov Rejects Compromise on European Troops in Ukraine

description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford on Tuesday responded to US President Donald Trump’s tariffs by ripping up the Canadian province’s contract with Elon Musk’s Starlink. “It’s done; it’s gone,” Ford said of the deal.
title: Canada’s Anti-Musk Pivot Hits Starlink’s Second-Biggest Market

description: Norway’s Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store unveiled plans for a “substantial” boost to Ukraine aid after President Donald Trump paused all US military aid to the warn-torn nation.
title: Norway Plans Ukraine Aid Boost That Delivers Fighting Power Fast

description: From Syria and Lebanon to Gaza and the West Bank, Israeli troops are establishing positions they are unlikely to abandon anytime soon.
title: Israel’s New Defense Policy Keeps Troops Abroad, Maybe for Good

description: Reporteros de Bloomberg News obtuvieron acceso exclusivo al reducto del expresidente, buscado por acusaciones de estupro
title: Convertido en fugitivo, Evo Morales se oculta en la selva boliviana

description: A look inside the rowdy encampment protecting Evo Morales from arrest on rape charges
title: Disgraced Leftist Hero Now Hides From the Law in Bolivian Jungle

description: The leader of Bosnia’s Serbs issued a ban on police and courts from Bosnia-Herzegovina’s central government from operating in Serb-ruled territory, jeopardizing the three-decade-old peace agreement that’s held the once war-torn country together.
title: Bosnian Serb Leader Bans Institutions, Defying Peace Accord

description: Romanian prosecutors detained six people suspected of plotting to overthrow the government and withdraw the Black Sea nation from NATO with Russia’s help.
title: Romania Detains Six People for Treason in Russia-Linked Probe

description: Protesters on the eve of an emergency EU summit in Brussels, on March 5. Photographer: Nicolas Tucat/Getty Images
title: EU Leaders Gather for Emergency Summit on Defense

description: China’s top economic officials said they have carved out plenty of room to act in the face of uncertainty and risks, after the country set an ambitious growth target for 2025 despite higher US tariffs.
title: China Signals It Has Policy Space to Counter Impact of Tariffs

description: India’s government must prepare to take action against the US if President Donald Trump follows through with his threat to impose higher import tariffs, a senior industry executive said.
title: India Urged to Counter US as ‘Street Fight’ Looms Over Tariffs

description: India’s top diplomat said relations with the US are on firm footing in comments that come as New Delhi looks to lower tariffs on imports to fend off President Donald Trump’s threatened reciprocal levies that could upend bilateral and global trade.
title: India Sees US Relations at ‘Best’ Despite Looming Tariff Threat

description: In most other years, an election in a sparsely populated Arctic island would fly largely under the radar. But as voters in Greenland head to the polls on March 11, they’ll be doing so under the shadow of US President Donald Trump wanting to take control of the semi-autonomous territory from Denmark.
title: What the Trump Factor Means for Greenland’s Election

description: The EU is getting ready to circumvent Hungary as it tries to come up with the money to maintain support for Kyiv and invest in defense.
title: Europe Tackles Its Orban Problem After Trump Rips Up Ukraine Aid

description: On this episode of In the City, former UK Security Minister Tom Tugendhat explains why “fundamentals” need to be reassessed.
title: Why Trump’s Ukraine Reversal May Be Europe’s ‘9-11 Moment’

description: Hong Kong’s top court overturned the convictions of three former members of a pro-democracy group, marking a rare victory in challenging the enforcement of the national security law imposed by Beijing.
title: Hong Kong’s Tiananmen Activists Win Rare Appeal in Security Case

description: President Donald Trump is poised to meet next week with leaders of some of the country’s largest tech companies, which are facing the prospect of import tariffs and stricter export rules that could upend their businesses.
title: Trump Set to Meet With Technology Leaders Early Next Week

description: Maine Senator Susan Collins said she has “areas of disagreement” with President Donald Trump’s nominee to lead the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, making the moderate Republican’s position key to the vote’s outcome.
title: Key Republican Concerned About Trump CDC Pick’s Vaccine Views

description: The Commerce Department is tapping former Morgan Stanley banker Michael Grimes to lead a planned sovereign wealth fund, part of President Donald Trump’s effort to give the US a stake in projects he considers critical to national security.
title: US to Name Morgan Stanley Banker to Lead Sovereign Wealth Fund
